required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing the Effectiveness, Immunogenicity and Safety of Meningococcal ABCWY Vaccine Administered to Healthy Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2b, Controlled, Observer-Blind, Multi-Center Study Assessing the Effectiveness, Immunogenicity and Safety of the 3rd Dose of Novartis Meningococcal ABCWY Vaccine Administered to Healthy Adolescents in the U.S.

brief_summary.textblock: This is extension of the V102_16 study (NCT02140762). V102_16E1 is designed to assess the effectiveness of a 3-dose vaccination series of MenABCWY, administered according to 0, 2, 6 month schedule, against the same panel of endemic US N. meningitidis serogroup B strains, as measured by enc-hSBA assay. The subjects who completed the parent V102_16 study will be invited at the time of their last study visit to participate in this extension study.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects Without Bactericidal Activity at 1:4 Dilution Against Each US Neisseria Meningitides (N. Meningitidis) Serogroup B Strain at 1 Month After the 3-dose Vaccination Series.
primary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 7 (1 month after the 3-dose vaccination series)
primary_outcome.description: The effectiveness of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine when compared to one dose of MenACWY vaccine against a panel of US N. meningitidis serogroup B invasive disease strains at 1 month after the 3-dose vaccination series was evaluated in terms of: the combined percentage of subjects without bactericidal activity at 1:4 dilution using the human Serum Bactericidal Assay (hSBA) against each strain in MenABCWY group and MenACWY group. The data provided is an average of the percentage of subjects without bactericidal activity at 1:4 dilution across all 110 strains.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects Without Bactericidal Activity at 1:4 Dilution Against Each US N. Meningitidis Serogroup B Strain at 4 Months After the 3-dose Vaccination Series.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 10 (4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series)
secondary_outcome.description: The effectiveness of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine when compared to one dose of MenACWY vaccine against a panel of US N. meningitidis serogroup B invasive disease strains at 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series was evaluated in terms of: the combined percentage of subjects without bactericidal activity at 1:4 dilution using the hSBA against each strain in MenABCWY Group and MenACWY Group. The data provided is an average of the percentage of subjects without bactericidal activity at 1:4 dilution across all 110 strains.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects Without Bactericidal Activity at 1:8 Dilution Against Each US N. Meningitidis Serogroup B Strain at 1 and 4 Months After the 3-dose Vaccination Series.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Months 7 and 10 (1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series)
secondary_outcome.description: The effectiveness of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine when compared to one dose of MenACWY vaccine against a panel of US N. meningitidis serogroup B invasive disease strains at 1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series were evaluated in terms of: the combined percentage of subjects without bactericidal activity at 1:8 dilution using the hSBA against each strain in MenABCWY Group and MenACWY Group. The data provided is an average of the percentage of subjects without bactericidal activity at 1:8 dilution across all 110 strains.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of US N. Meningitidis Serogroup B Strains Killed at 1:4 and 1:8 Dilutions at 1 and 4 Months After the 3-dose Vaccination Series
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 6 (before the 3-dose vaccination series) and at Months 7 and 10 (1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series)
secondary_outcome.description: The mean percentage of US N. meningitidis serogroup B strains killed by each subject, at 1:4 and 1:8 dilutions before the 3-dose vaccination series, at Month 6 (PRE) and at 1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series (Month 7 and Month 10).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With Enc-hSBA ≥ 1:4 and Enc-hSBA ≥1:8 at 1 and 4 Months After the 3-dose Vaccination Series
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Months 7 and 10 (1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series)
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine compared to a single dose of MenACWY vaccine, in terms of percentages of subjects with enc-hSBA ≥ 1:4 and enc-hSBA ≥ 1:8 against four N. meningitidis serogroup B test strains (M14459, M07-0241084, 96217 and NZ98/254) at 1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series (Month 7 and Month 10).

secondary_outcome.measure: HT-hSBA Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) Against the N. Meningitidis Serogroup B Test Strains
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Months 7 and 10 (1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series)
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine compared to a single dose of MenACWY vaccine, in terms of HT-hSBA GMTs against four N. meningitidis serogroup B test strains (M14459, M07-0241084, 96217 and NZ98/254) after the 3-dose vaccination series.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With HT-hSBA Titers Against N. Meningitidis Serogroup B Test Strains ≥ Lower Limit of Quantitation (LLQ) at 1 Month After the 3-dose Vaccination Series.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 7 (1 month after the 3-dose vaccination series)
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine compared to a single dose of MenACWY, in terms of percentages of subjects with HT-hSBA titers ≥ LLQ (≥ 5, ≥ 8, ≥ 16, ≥ 32, ≥ 64, ≥ 128) against serogroup N. meningitidis B test strains (M14459, M07-0241084, 96217 and NZ98/254), at 1 month after the 3-dose vaccination series.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With HT-hSBA Titers Against N. Meningitidis Serogroup B Test Strains ≥ LLQ at 4 Months After the 3-dose Vaccination Series
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 10 (4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series)
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine compared to a single dose of MenACWY, in terms of percentages of subjects with HT-hSBA titers ≥ LLQ (≥ 5, ≥ 8, ≥ 16, ≥ 32, ≥ 64, ≥ 128) against serogroup N. meningitidis B test strains (M14459, M07-0241084, 96217 and NZ98/254), at 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With a Four-fold Rise in HT-hSBA Titers Against the N. Meningitidis Serogroup B Test Strains at 1 and 4 Months After the 3-dose Vaccination Series.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Months 7 and 10 (1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series)
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine compared to a single dose of MenACWY, in terms of the percentages of subjects with a four-fold rise in HT-hSBA titers against the N. meningitidis serogroup B test strains, at 1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series. The four-fold titers rise is defined as: a) for subjects with pre-vaccination HT-hSBA titers < LLQ, postvaccination HT-hSBA titers ≥ 4 LLQ; b) for subjects with pre-vaccination HT-hSBA titers ≥ LLQ, an increase of at least four times the pre-vaccination HT-hSBA titers.

secondary_outcome.measure: HT-hSBA GMTs Against N. Meningitidis Serogroups A, C, W and Y.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Months 7 and 10 (1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series)
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of three doses of MenABCWY compared to a single dose of MenACWY vaccine, in terms of HT-hSBA GMTs to serogroups A, C, W, and Y, at 1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With HT-hSBA Titers Against the N. Meningitidis Serogroup A, C, W and Y ≥ LLQ at 1 Month After the 3- Dose Vaccination Series
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 7 (1 month after the 3-dose vaccination series)
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine compared to a single dose of MenACWY, in terms of the percentages of subjects with HT-hSBA titers ≥ LLQ (≥ 8, ≥ 16, ≥ 32, ≥ 64, ≥128) against serogroups A, C, W, Y, at 1 month after the 3-dose vaccination series.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With HT-hSBA Titers Against the N. Meningitidis Serogroup A, C, W and Y ≥ LLQ at 4 Months After the 3-dose Vaccination Series
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Month 10 (4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series)
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine compared to a single dose of MenACWY, in terms of the percentages of subjects with HT-hSBA titers ≥ LLQ (≥ 8, ≥ 16, ≥ 32, ≥ 64, ≥ 128) against serogroups A, C, W, Y, at 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Solicited Local or Systemic Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (6 hours) to Day 7 after vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects reporting any solicited local or systemic AEs from Day 1 (6 hours) to Day 7 after any meningococcal vaccination is reported. Assessed solicited local symptoms were induration, erythema and pain. Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, myalgia, arthralgia, headache, fever, chills and loss of appetite. Other solicited data included prevention of pain/fever and treatment of pain/fever. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Unsolicited AEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to Day 30 after any vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects reporting unsolicited AEs after any vaccination is reported. An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Medically-attended AEs and AEs Leading to Premature Withdrawal.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (from Day 0 up to Month 10)
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects reporting any SAEs, medically-attended AEs and AEs leading to premature withdrawal during the entire study period is reported. SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life-threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity. MAEs were defined as events for which the subject received medical attention defined as hospitalization, an emergency room visit, or a visit to or from medical personnel (medical doctor) for any reason. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensitygrade or relation to vaccination.

arm_group.description: Subjects who received 2 doses of MenABCWY vaccine in the parent study and a 3rd dose of MenABCWY vaccine in the current study.
Subjects who received 1 dose of placebo and 1 dose of MenACWY vaccine in the parent study and 1 dose of placebo in the current study.

intervention.description: One dose administered intramuscularly in the deltoid area of a non-dominant arm at Month 6 (Visit 1)
One dose of placebo administered intramuscularly in the deltoid area of a non-dominant arm at Month 6 (Visit 1)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adolescents who completed V102_16 study and received the study vaccines as assigned in the protocol (either two doses of the MenABCWY or one dose each of MenACWY and Placebo).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Serious, acute, or chronic illnesses. Previous or suspected disease caused by N. meningitidis.
- History of any meningococcal vaccine administration other than vaccination given in the parent V102_16 protocol.

group.title: MenABCWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 2 doses of MenABCWY vaccine in the parent study and a 3rd dose of MenABCWY vaccine in the current study.

group.title: MenACWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 1 dose of placebo and 1 dose of MenACWY vaccine in the parent study and 1 dose of placebo in the current study.

group.title: MenABCWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 2 doses of MenABCWY vaccine in the parent study and a 3rd dose of MenABCWY vaccine in the current study.

group.title: MenACWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 1 dose of placebo and 1 dose of MenACWY vaccine in the parent study and 1 dose of placebo in the current study.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

class.title: NATIVE HAWAIIAN OR OTHER PACIFIC ISLANDER

outcome.title: Percentages of Subjects Without Bactericidal Activity at 1:4 Dilution Against Each US Neisseria Meningitides (N. Meningitidis) Serogroup B Strain at 1 Month After the 3-dose Vaccination Series.
outcome.description: The effectiveness of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine when compared to one dose of MenACWY vaccine against a panel of US N. meningitidis serogroup B invasive disease strains at 1 month after the 3-dose vaccination series was evaluated in terms of: the combined percentage of subjects without bactericidal activity at 1:4 dilution using the human Serum Bactericidal Assay (hSBA) against each strain in MenABCWY group and MenACWY group. The data provided is an average of the percentage of subjects without bactericidal activity at 1:4 dilution across all 110 strains.
outcome.time_frame: At Month 7 (1 month after the 3-dose vaccination series)
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on FAS-Effectiveness (Month 7)- included all screened subjects who provided informed consent & demographic &/or baseline screening assessments, received a subject ID & vaccination,& who provided evaluable serum sample with enc-hSBA result for at least 1 endemic N. meningitidis serogroup B invasive disease strain at Month 7.

group.title: MenABCWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 2 doses of MenABCWY vaccine in the parent study and a 3rd dose of MenABCWY vaccine in the current study.

group.title: MenACWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 1 dose of placebo and 1 dose of MenACWY vaccine in the parent study and 1 dose of placebo in the current study.

measure.title: Percentages of Subjects Without Bactericidal Activity at 1:4 Dilution Against Each US Neisseria Meningitides (N. Meningitidis) Serogroup B Strain at 1 Month After the 3-dose Vaccination Series.
measure.description: The effectiveness of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine when compared to one dose of MenACWY vaccine against a panel of US N. meningitidis serogroup B invasive disease strains at 1 month after the 3-dose vaccination series was evaluated in terms of: the combined percentage of subjects without bactericidal activity at 1:4 dilution using the human Serum Bactericidal Assay (hSBA) against each strain in MenABCWY group and MenACWY group. The data provided is an average of the percentage of subjects without bactericidal activity at 1:4 dilution across all 110 strains.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on FAS-Effectiveness (Month 7)- included all screened subjects who provided informed consent & demographic &/or baseline screening assessments, received a subject ID & vaccination,& who provided evaluable serum sample with enc-hSBA result for at least 1 endemic N. meningitidis serogroup B invasive disease strain at Month 7.

analysis.groups_desc: The Vaccine Effectiveness (VE) at 1 month after the 3-dose vaccination series for each strain is defined as [1 - (percentage of subjects without bactericidal activity at 1:4 dilution in MenABCWY group/percentage of subjects without bactericidal activity at 1:4 dilution in MenACWY group)] x 100.The combined VE across all strains was computed by mean of a generalized linear model.
analysis.method_desc: To obtain the VE measure which is a measure based on RR, BINOMIAL DISTRIBUTION & LOG LINK options were used to compute log10 RR & corresponding CI.

outcome.title: Percentages of Subjects Without Bactericidal Activity at 1:4 Dilution Against Each US N. Meningitidis Serogroup B Strain at 4 Months After the 3-dose Vaccination Series.
outcome.description: The effectiveness of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine when compared to one dose of MenACWY vaccine against a panel of US N. meningitidis serogroup B invasive disease strains at 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series was evaluated in terms of: the combined percentage of subjects without bactericidal activity at 1:4 dilution using the hSBA against each strain in MenABCWY Group and MenACWY Group. The data provided is an average of the percentage of subjects without bactericidal activity at 1:4 dilution across all 110 strains.
outcome.time_frame: At Month 10 (4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series)
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on FAS-Effectiveness (Month 10)- included all screened subjects who provided informed consent & demographic &/or baseline screening assessments, received a subject ID & vaccination, & provided evaluable serum sample with the enc-hSBA result for at least 1 endemic N. meningitidis serogroup B invasive disease strain at Month 10

outcome.title: Percentages of US N. Meningitidis Serogroup B Strains Killed at 1:4 and 1:8 Dilutions at 1 and 4 Months After the 3-dose Vaccination Series
outcome.description: The mean percentage of US N. meningitidis serogroup B strains killed by each subject, at 1:4 and 1:8 dilutions before the 3-dose vaccination series, at Month 6 (PRE) and at 1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series (Month 7 and Month 10).
outcome.time_frame: At Month 6 (before the 3-dose vaccination series) and at Months 7 and 10 (1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series)
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on FAS-Effectiveness (Months 6, 7 & 10)- included all screened subjects who provided consent & demographic &/or baseline screening assessments, got subject ID & vaccination, & provided serum sample with enc-hSBA result for at least 1 endemic N. meningitidis serogroup B invasive disease strain before Month 6 & at Months 7 & 10

outcome.population: Analysis was performed on FAS-Immunogenicity (Months 7 &10)- included all screened subjects who provided consent & demographic &/or baseline screening assessments, received a subject ID & vaccination, & provided evaluable serum samples at Months 7 & 10 & whose immunogenicity assay result was available for at least one serogroup B test strain.

measure.title: Percentages of Subjects With HT-hSBA Titers Against N. Meningitidis Serogroup B Test Strains ≥ Lower Limit of Quantitation (LLQ) at 1 Month After the 3-dose Vaccination Series.
measure.description: The immunogenicity of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine compared to a single dose of MenACWY, in terms of percentages of subjects with HT-hSBA titers ≥ LLQ (≥ 5, ≥ 8, ≥ 16, ≥ 32, ≥ 64, ≥ 128) against serogroup N. meningitidis B test strains (M14459, M07-0241084, 96217 and NZ98/254), at 1 month after the 3-dose vaccination series.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on FAS-Immunogenicity (Month 7)- included all screened subjects who provided consent & demographic &/or baseline screening assessments, received a subject ID & vaccination, & provided evaluable serum samples at Month 7 & whose immunogenicity assay result was available for at least one serogroup B test strain.

outcome.title: Percentages of Subjects With HT-hSBA Titers Against N. Meningitidis Serogroup B Test Strains ≥ LLQ at 4 Months After the 3-dose Vaccination Series
outcome.description: The immunogenicity of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine compared to a single dose of MenACWY, in terms of percentages of subjects with HT-hSBA titers ≥ LLQ (≥ 5, ≥ 8, ≥ 16, ≥ 32, ≥ 64, ≥ 128) against serogroup N. meningitidis B test strains (M14459, M07-0241084, 96217 and NZ98/254), at 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series.
outcome.time_frame: At Month 10 (4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series)
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on FAS-Immunogenicity (Month 10)- included all screened subjects who provided consent & demographic &/or baseline screening assessments, received a subject ID & vaccination, & provided evaluable serum samples at Month 10 & whose immunogenicity assay result was available for at least one serogroup B test strain.

group.title: MenABCWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 2 doses of MenABCWY vaccine in the parent study and a 3rd dose of MenABCWY vaccine in the current study.

group.title: MenACWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 1 dose of placebo and 1 dose of MenACWY vaccine in the parent study and 1 dose of placebo in the current study.

measure.title: Percentages of Subjects With HT-hSBA Titers Against N. Meningitidis Serogroup B Test Strains ≥ LLQ at 4 Months After the 3-dose Vaccination Series
measure.description: The immunogenicity of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine compared to a single dose of MenACWY, in terms of percentages of subjects with HT-hSBA titers ≥ LLQ (≥ 5, ≥ 8, ≥ 16, ≥ 32, ≥ 64, ≥ 128) against serogroup N. meningitidis B test strains (M14459, M07-0241084, 96217 and NZ98/254), at 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on FAS-Immunogenicity (Month 10)- included all screened subjects who provided consent & demographic &/or baseline screening assessments, received a subject ID & vaccination, & provided evaluable serum samples at Month 10 & whose immunogenicity assay result was available for at least one serogroup B test strain.

outcome.title: Percentages of Subjects With a Four-fold Rise in HT-hSBA Titers Against the N. Meningitidis Serogroup B Test Strains at 1 and 4 Months After the 3-dose Vaccination Series.
outcome.description: The immunogenicity of three doses of MenABCWY vaccine compared to a single dose of MenACWY, in terms of the percentages of subjects with a four-fold rise in HT-hSBA titers against the N. meningitidis serogroup B test strains, at 1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series. The four-fold titers rise is defined as: a) for subjects with pre-vaccination HT-hSBA titers < LLQ, postvaccination HT-hSBA titers ≥ 4 LLQ; b) for subjects with pre-vaccination HT-hSBA titers ≥ LLQ, an increase of at least four times the pre-vaccination HT-hSBA titers.
outcome.time_frame: At Months 7 and 10 (1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series)

outcome.title: HT-hSBA GMTs Against N. Meningitidis Serogroups A, C, W and Y.
outcome.description: The immunogenicity of three doses of MenABCWY compared to a single dose of MenACWY vaccine, in terms of HT-hSBA GMTs to serogroups A, C, W, and Y, at 1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series.
outcome.time_frame: At Months 7 and 10 (1 and 4 months after the 3-dose vaccination series)
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on FAS-Immunogenicity (Months 7 &10)- included all screened subjects who provided consent & demographic &/or baseline screening assessments, received a subject ID & vaccination, & provided evaluable serum samples at Months 7 & 10 & whose immunogenicity assay result was available for at least one serogroup B test strain.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Solicited Local or Systemic Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: Number of subjects reporting any solicited local or systemic AEs from Day 1 (6 hours) to Day 7 after any meningococcal vaccination is reported. Assessed solicited local symptoms were induration, erythema and pain. Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, myalgia, arthralgia, headache, fever, chills and loss of appetite. Other solicited data included prevention of pain/fever and treatment of pain/fever. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (6 hours) to Day 7 after vaccination
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on Safety Set (solicited AEs & other solicited reactions)-included all screened subjects who provided consent & demographic &/or baseline screening assessments, received a subject ID & a study vaccination, & provided post-vaccination reactogenicity data.

group.title: MenABCWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 2 doses of MenABCWY vaccine in the parent study and a 3rd dose of MenABCWY vaccine in the current study.

group.title: MenACWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 1 dose of placebo and 1 dose of MenACWY vaccine in the parent study and 1 dose of placebo in the current study.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Solicited Local or Systemic Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: Number of subjects reporting any solicited local or systemic AEs from Day 1 (6 hours) to Day 7 after any meningococcal vaccination is reported. Assessed solicited local symptoms were induration, erythema and pain. Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, myalgia, arthralgia, headache, fever, chills and loss of appetite. Other solicited data included prevention of pain/fever and treatment of pain/fever. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on Safety Set (solicited AEs & other solicited reactions)-included all screened subjects who provided consent & demographic &/or baseline screening assessments, received a subject ID & a study vaccination, & provided post-vaccination reactogenicity data.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Unsolicited AEs
outcome.description: The number of subjects reporting unsolicited AEs after any vaccination is reported. An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to Day 30 after any vaccination
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on Safety set (unsolicited AEs)- included all screened subjects who provided informed consent & demographic and/or baseline screening assessments, received a subject ID and a study vaccination, and had post-vaccination unsolicited adverse event records.

group.title: MenABCWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 2 doses of MenABCWY vaccine in the parent study and a 3rd dose of MenABCWY vaccine in the current study.

group.title: MenACWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 1 dose of placebo and 1 dose of MenACWY vaccine in the parent study and 1 dose of placebo in the current study.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Unsolicited AEs
measure.description: The number of subjects reporting unsolicited AEs after any vaccination is reported. An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on Safety set (unsolicited AEs)- included all screened subjects who provided informed consent & demographic and/or baseline screening assessments, received a subject ID and a study vaccination, and had post-vaccination unsolicited adverse event records.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Medically-attended AEs and AEs Leading to Premature Withdrawal.
outcome.description: The number of subjects reporting any SAEs, medically-attended AEs and AEs leading to premature withdrawal during the entire study period is reported. SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life-threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity. MAEs were defined as events for which the subject received medical attention defined as hospitalization, an emergency room visit, or a visit to or from medical personnel (medical doctor) for any reason. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensitygrade or relation to vaccination.
outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (from Day 0 up to Month 10)
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on Safety Set (overall)- included all screened subjects who provide informed consent and demographic and/or baseline screening assessments, received a subject ID and a study vaccination, and have either post-vaccination reactogenicity data or post-vaccination unsolicited adverse event records.

group.title: MenABCWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 2 doses of MenABCWY vaccine in the parent study and a 3rd dose of MenABCWY vaccine in the current study.

group.title: MenACWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 1 dose of placebo and 1 dose of MenACWY vaccine in the parent study and 1 dose of placebo in the current study.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Medically-attended AEs and AEs Leading to Premature Withdrawal.
measure.description: The number of subjects reporting any SAEs, medically-attended AEs and AEs leading to premature withdrawal during the entire study period is reported. SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life-threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity. MAEs were defined as events for which the subject received medical attention defined as hospitalization, an emergency room visit, or a visit to or from medical personnel (medical doctor) for any reason. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensitygrade or relation to vaccination.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on Safety Set (overall)- included all screened subjects who provide informed consent and demographic and/or baseline screening assessments, received a subject ID and a study vaccination, and have either post-vaccination reactogenicity data or post-vaccination unsolicited adverse event records.

class.title: Any AEs leading to premature withdrawal

reported_events.time_frame: Solicited local and general AEs were collected from Day 1 to Day 7. Unsolicited AEs were collected from Day 1 to Day 30. SAEs, medically-attended AEs and AEs leading to withdrawal are collected for the entire duration of the study (from Day 0 to Month 10).
reported_events.desc: Data are presented in terms of number of subjects reporting AEs. The total number of subjects at risk for the frequent adverse events were analysed from the exposed set and the number of subjects at risk for each of the adverse event were analysed from the overall safety set. Therefore, the number of subjects at risk for each adverse event is lesser than the total number of subjects at risk.

group.title: MenABCWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 2 doses of MenABCWY vaccine in the parent study and a 3rd dose of MenABCWY vaccine in the current study.

group.title: MenACWY Group
group.description: Subjects who received 1 dose of placebo and 1 dose of MenACWY vaccine in the parent study and 1 dose of placebo in the current study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
